dt: {bc}to make lucid especially by explanation or analysis

pt: {sc}explain{/sc} {sc}expound{/sc} {sc}explicate{/sc} {sc}elucidate{/sc} {sc}interpret{/sc} mean to make something clear or understandable. {sc}explain{/sc} implies a making plain or intelligible what is not immediately obvious or entirely known.
{sc}expound{/sc} implies a careful often elaborate explanation.
{sc}explicate{/sc} adds the idea of a developed or detailed analysis.
{sc}elucidate{/sc} stresses the throwing of light upon as by offering details or motives previously unclear or only implicit.
{sc}interpret{/sc} adds to {sc}explain{/sc} the need for imagination or sympathy or special knowledge in dealing with something.

et: Late Latin {it}elucidatus{/it}, past participle of {it}elucidare{/it}, from Latin {it}e-{/it} + {it}lucidus{/it} lucid
shortdef: to make lucid especially by explanation or analysis
